intro: Cordylogyne kaessnerianum, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tonga. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped inflorescences that resemble a Christmas star, hence its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a dense, spherical cluster. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Cordylogyne kaessnerianum is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
